author: Special Correspondent
text:
Only eight more days are there for young Picassos to send their entries for the prestigious The Hindu Young World Painting Competition, presented by Thyrocare.

The competition will be held under two categories – juniors (classes 4 to 6) and seniors (classes 7 to 9). Children have to register online to generate a unique ID, which should be written on the top of the drawing. The art work should be certified as original either by the head of institution or art teacher.

The entries, with the unique ID and attestation, can be sent to any of the 21 centres where the student wants to participate in the finals to be held on March 13/14.

Students selected for the finals will be intimated individually and they should report at the venue with the intimation letter. Topics will be given on the spot for the finals and prizes to the winners will be distributed in the afternoon.

The last date for sending entries is February 27. For registration and more details, log on towww.thehindu.com/
